values.title: Simbody nullptr

values.description:
prevents issue on windows where running either gzserver or gzclient when the shader directory already existed would cause an exception.

It seems that version of mkdir fails if the directory already exists. The underscore one is the "standard compliant" one it seems.

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms235326(v=vs.120).aspx
values.title: Use non-deprecated version of mkdir on windows

summary.raw:
prevents issue on windows where running either gzserver or gzclient when the shader directory already existed would cause an exception.

It seems that version of mkdir fails if the directory already exists. The underscore one is the "standard compliant" one it seems.

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms235326(v=vs.120).aspx

values.description: This changes the gazebo plugins to use the `MODULE` keyword to cmake's `add_library()` function instead of `SHARED` as discussed in #800. This changes the suffix on OS X from `.dylib` to `.so`, so the previous hack of replacing `.so` with `.dylib` when loading plugins on OS X is changed to deprecated behavior. For gazebo8, `.dylib` plugins will continue to load if a `.so` is not found, but a warning message will print to the console. The `test/plugins` folder is currently retaining the `SHARED` keyword to provide a test case for this functionality but should be changed to use `MODULE` when the deprecated functionality is removed.
values.title: Build plugin libraries as MODULE instead of SHARED

summary.raw: This changes the gazebo plugins to use the `MODULE` keyword to cmake's `add_library()` function instead of `SHARED` as discussed in #800. This changes the suffix on OS X from `.dylib` to `.so`, so the previous hack of replacing `.so` with `.dylib` when loading plugins on OS X is changed to deprecated behavior. For gazebo8, `.dylib` plugins will continue to load if a `.so` is not found, but a warning message will print to the console. The `test/plugins` folder is currently retaining the `SHARED` keyword to provide a test case for this functionality but should be changed to use `MODULE` when the deprecated functionality is removed.
summary.html: This changes the gazebo plugins to use the MODULE keyword to cmake's add_library() function instead of SHARED as discussed in #800. This changes the suffix on OS X from .dylib to .so, so the previous hack of replacing .so with .dylib when loading plugins on OS X is changed to deprecated behavior. For gazebo8, .dylib plugins will continue to load if a .so is not found, but a warning message will print to the console. The test/plugins folder is currently retaining the SHARED keyword to provide a test case for this functionality but should be changed to use MODULE when the deprecated functionality is removed.

values.description:
issue #1960

The problem was that the physics engine took an extra `UpdateCollision` and `UpdatePhysics` call which caused overlapping models to be pushed apart. This issue only happens only when reset is requested over the `~/world_control` topic, e.g. by pressing Ctrl+R in gzclient. 

An easy way to test is to start gazebo paused, insert 2 overlapping models, and hit Reset.



jenkins:

[gpu-none](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/406/) - ok
values.title: Fix resetting model to initial pose

An easy way to test is to start gazebo paused, insert 2 overlapping models, and hit Reset.

values.description:
While working on [using ignition transport to delete/insert entities](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/insertion_deletion_flow/insertion_deletion_flow/insertion_deletion_flow.md?fileviewer=file-view-default), the transport node for `gui/*Maker` classes was not needed any more.

This pull request moves the node to the derived classes and removes `EntityMakerPrivate`, which is no longer needed. Future pull requests will completely remove gazebo transport from these classes.

In case you're curious about where this is going, take a look at branch [ignition_delete](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/ignition_delete%0Ddefault#diff).


[coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/562/) :large_blue_circle:
values.title: Move EntityMaker private member to derived classes

summary.raw:
While working on [using ignition transport to delete/insert entities](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/insertion_deletion_flow/insertion_deletion_flow/insertion_deletion_flow.md?fileviewer=file-view-default), the transport node for `gui/*Maker` classes was not needed any more.

This pull request moves the node to the derived classes and removes `EntityMakerPrivate`, which is no longer needed. Future pull requests will completely remove gazebo transport from these classes.

In case you're curious about where this is going, take a look at branch [ignition_delete](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/ignition_delete%0Ddefault#diff).


[coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/562/) :large_blue_circle:
summary.html:
While working on using ignition transport to delete/insert entities, the transport node for gui/*Maker classes was not needed any more.

This pull request moves the node to the derived classes and removes EntityMakerPrivate, which is no longer needed. Future pull requests will completely remove gazebo transport from these classes.

In case you're curious about where this is going, take a look at branch ignition_delete.

coverage :large_blue_circle:

values.description:
GZ_PLUGIN_VISIBLE is now always defined, regardless of the BUILDING_STATIC_LIBS
flag. Plugins always have to be dll's, so this makes sure they are.
This also uses GZ_PLUGIN_VISIBLE on the macros, so the RegisterPlugin function
is exported correctly

As mentioned in Issue 800, The .dll ending hack will be fixed in a less hacky way in the near future. For now though this will suffice.
values.title: Ensure plugin and plugin-macros are always exported

summary.raw:
GZ_PLUGIN_VISIBLE is now always defined, regardless of the BUILDING_STATIC_LIBS
flag. Plugins always have to be dll's, so this makes sure they are.
This also uses GZ_PLUGIN_VISIBLE on the macros, so the RegisterPlugin function
is exported correctly

As mentioned in Issue 800, The .dll ending hack will be fixed in a less hacky way in the near future. For now though this will suffice.
summary.html:
GZ_PLUGIN_VISIBLE is now always defined, regardless of the BUILDING_STATIC_LIBS flag. Plugins always have to be dll's, so this makes sure they are. This also uses GZ_PLUGIN_VISIBLE on the macros, so the RegisterPlugin function is exported correctly

As mentioned in Issue 800, The .dll ending hack will be fixed in a less hacky way in the near future. For now though this will suffice.

values.description:
When doing a World Reset using Ctrl+R, we noticed that sometimes the Rotate mode is accidentally triggered. This is because we tend to release the Ctrl key before R causing the keyRelease event handler to process the key with no modifier key.

PR changes the event handling of RTS keys to the `keyPress` event.

More of a usability improvement than a bug fix.

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/414/testReport/) - ok
values.title: Handle model manipulation tool RTS shortcuts in keyPress

summary.raw:
When doing a World Reset using Ctrl+R, we noticed that sometimes the Rotate mode is accidentally triggered. This is because we tend to release the Ctrl key before R causing the keyRelease event handler to process the key with no modifier key.

PR changes the event handling of RTS keys to the `keyPress` event.

More of a usability improvement than a bug fix.

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/414/testReport/) - ok
summary.html:
When doing a World Reset using Ctrl+R, we noticed that sometimes the Rotate mode is accidentally triggered. This is because we tend to release the Ctrl key before R causing the keyRelease event handler to process the key with no modifier key.

PR changes the event handling of RTS keys to the keyPress event.

More of a usability improvement than a bug fix.

homebrew - ok

values.description:
pull request #2272 back ported a fix for #1917 (camera sensors stop updating after reset world). There was a slight difference in the back ported test that seemed wrong to me, which I noticed when trying to merge gazebo6 forward to gazebo7.

In the [gazebo7 version of this test](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/b726a04ffa5a2231088505d0904446716ab6f7e0/test/integration/camera_sensor.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#camera_sensor.cc-107),
the `simTime` variable is set before the `World::Reset` call. It doesn't make sense to get the sim time after the reset, because it will just be zero.
values.title: Fix backport of camera sensor test

summary.raw:
pull request #2272 back ported a fix for #1917 (camera sensors stop updating after reset world). There was a slight difference in the back ported test that seemed wrong to me, which I noticed when trying to merge gazebo6 forward to gazebo7.

In the [gazebo7 version of this test](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/b726a04ffa5a2231088505d0904446716ab6f7e0/test/integration/camera_sensor.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#camera_sensor.cc-107),
the `simTime` variable is set before the `World::Reset` call. It doesn't make sense to get the sim time after the reset, because it will just be zero.
summary.html:
pull request #2272 back ported a fix for #1917 (camera sensors stop updating after reset world). There was a slight difference in the back ported test that seemed wrong to me, which I noticed when trying to merge gazebo6 forward to gazebo7.

In the gazebo7 version of this test, the simTime variable is set before the World::Reset call. It doesn't make sense to get the sim time after the reset, because it will just be zero.

values.description:
issue #1791

Should now be able to zoom, pan, and rotate around a visual in model editor

One caveat is that it's now possible to focus on the RTS selection obj visual but I think it's generally fine. I can update the behavior to prevent focusing on the selection obj visual if that's preferred.

One caveat is that it's now possible to focus on the RTS selection obj visual but I think it's generally fine. I can update the behavior to prevent focusing on the selection obj visual if that's preferred.

Should now be able to zoom, pan, and rotate around a visual in model editor

One caveat is that it's now possible to focus on the RTS selection obj visual but I think it's generally fine. I can update the behavior to prevent focusing on the selection obj visual if that's preferred.

values.description:
issue #1959

* fix acceleration to be in the imu frame.
* add SetWorldToReferencePose function to set the reference frame definition for this imu in the world.
* added bunch of imu tests
* work with options from [sdf PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/274/add-reference_frame-attribute-for-imu/diff)
* added a quaternion test to help me confirm some suspicions about how things work :)

* work with options from [sdf PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/274/add-reference_frame-attribute-for-imu/diff)

values.description:
Redo of pull request #2107, which was broken into:

* pull request #2220 (merged)
* pull request #2263 (merged)
* pull request #2309 (merged)
* this PR

This pull request makes it possible to open a world  without restarting the server. The client is not working yet, so a way to test this would be:

1. Build the example publishers added in this PR

2. Start gzserver with a world of your choosing

3. Publish either a new world or open world message using the standalone publishers:
    * ./pub_new_world
    * ./pub_open_world <full path>

4. Now open gzclient and check that the new world has been opened and there are no traces of the old world.

[trusty gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/414/) ok

[ABI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/1/API_ABI_report/) not broken
values.title: A whole new world all over again (server side)

  2. Start gzserver with a world of your choosing

  3. Publish either a new world or open world message using the standalone publishers:

values.reason: Fixing issues. Will re-open when ready.

values.description: Rays created by a laser sensor start at a the sensor position with an offset that corresponds to the min_range SDF parameter. The problem is that if the sensor is closed to another surface element, its rays will go through that element (see issue [#1564](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/1564/ray-sensor-looking-through-walls)). This pull request fixes this issue and also makes sure that rays are not displayed when their length is below min_range.
values.title: Fix laser collision below min_range

summary.raw: Rays created by a laser sensor start at a the sensor position with an offset that corresponds to the min_range SDF parameter. The problem is that if the sensor is closed to another surface element, its rays will go through that element (see issue [#1564](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/1564/ray-sensor-looking-through-walls)). This pull request fixes this issue and also makes sure that rays are not displayed when their length is below min_range.
summary.html: Rays created by a laser sensor start at a the sensor position with an offset that corresponds to the min_range SDF parameter. The problem is that if the sensor is closed to another surface element, its rays will go through that element (see issue #1564). This pull request fixes this issue and also makes sure that rays are not displayed when their length is below min_range.

values.description: There is currently no guarantee that gzclient gets killed before gzserver when sending a SIGINT signal to gazebo. This pull request makes sure that it is always the case.
values.title: Make sure gzclient is stopped first, before killing gzserver

summary.raw: There is currently no guarantee that gzclient gets killed before gzserver when sending a SIGINT signal to gazebo. This pull request makes sure that it is always the case.
summary.html: There is currently no guarantee that gzclient gets killed before gzserver when sending a SIGINT signal to gazebo. This pull request makes sure that it is always the case.

values.description: When gzclient exits, gzserver still maintains a list of obsolete callbacks in its `Publication` instances. This results in gzserver being extremely slow during its exit stage, especially with large worlds that contain many entities. This pull request makes sure that all callbacks are removed every time a gzclient exits.
values.title: Make sure gzserver destroys all callbacks when gzclient exits

summary.raw: When gzclient exits, gzserver still maintains a list of obsolete callbacks in its `Publication` instances. This results in gzserver being extremely slow during its exit stage, especially with large worlds that contain many entities. This pull request makes sure that all callbacks are removed every time a gzclient exits.
summary.html: When gzclient exits, gzserver still maintains a list of obsolete callbacks in its Publication instances. This results in gzserver being extremely slow during its exit stage, especially with large worlds that contain many entities. This pull request makes sure that all callbacks are removed every time a gzclient exits.

values.description:
Issue #402 - Undo / redo scaling links

Also removed the little gazebo math which was left in the model editor. Now all the gazebo math being used is coming from other API and immediately being converted to ignition math with `Ign()`.

values.description:
I was mostly curious about whether there were classes in gazebo math which have been completely substituted already. That happened to be the case for the splines, but I haven't checked whether there are other classes in the same situation.

I added `-Wno-deprecated-declarations` to suppress deprecation warnings within the math library.

Feel free to decline this pull request if it is not the way we were planning on deprecating gazebo math.

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI any jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/449) has no deprecation warnings

[trusty gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/429/) has no deprecation warnings
values.title: Deprecate gazebo::math::Spline and gazebo::math::RotationSpline

summary.raw:
I was mostly curious about whether there were classes in gazebo math which have been completely substituted already. That happened to be the case for the splines, but I haven't checked whether there are other classes in the same situation.

I added `-Wno-deprecated-declarations` to suppress deprecation warnings within the math library.

Feel free to decline this pull request if it is not the way we were planning on deprecating gazebo math.

summary.html:
I was mostly curious about whether there were classes in gazebo math which have been completely substituted already. That happened to be the case for the splines, but I haven't checked whether there are other classes in the same situation.

I added -Wno-deprecated-declarations to suppress deprecation warnings within the math library.

Feel free to decline this pull request if it is not the way we were planning on deprecating gazebo math.

homebrew has no deprecation warnings

trusty gpu has no deprecation warnings

values.description:
The homebrew build is almost clean; only the `ModelManipulationTest.StopProcessingPoseMsgs` is [failing consistently on homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/91/testReport/) right now.

As discussed in #1911, that test is failing because the `resMaxPercentChange` is set to 5.0, but values up to 6.8 can be observed on homebrew (both jenkins and my laptop).

I'm not sure what the underlying cause is, but I've increased the tolerance for now so jenkins won't mark it as a failure. We can leave the issue open if we want to come back to it.
values.title: Increase resMaxPercentChange for test to resolve issue #1911

summary.html:
The homebrew build is almost clean; only the ModelManipulationTest.StopProcessingPoseMsgs is failing consistently on homebrew right now.

As discussed in #1911, that test is failing because the resMaxPercentChange is set to 5.0, but values up to 6.8 can be observed on homebrew (both jenkins and my laptop).

I'm not sure what the underlying cause is, but I've increased the tolerance for now so jenkins won't mark it as a failure. We can leave the issue open if we want to come back to it.

values.description:
I've tested this branch, and I've noticed two different test failures in `UNIT_ModelListWidget_TEST`:

ModelProperties:
~~~
$ gazebo/gui/UNIT_ModelListWidget_TEST ModelProperties
********* Start testing of ModelListWidget_TEST *********
Config: Using QTest library 4.8.6, Qt 4.8.6
PASS   : ModelListWidget_TEST::initTestCase()
[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11368
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.2.91
[Wrn] [ODEPhysics.cc:214] Gravity vector is (0, 0, 0). Objects will float.
FAIL!  : ModelListWidget_TEST::ModelProperties() 'modelItem->isSelected()' returned FALSE. ()
   Loc: [/data_fast/scpeters/ws/tmp/gazebo_build/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget_TEST.cc(444)]
QWARN  : ModelListWidget_TEST::ModelProperties() QObject::connect: Cannot queue arguments of type 'QItemSelection'
(Make sure 'QItemSelection' is registered using qRegisterMetaType().)
QWARN  : ModelListWidget_TEST::ModelProperties() QObject::connect: Cannot queue arguments of type 'QItemSelection'
(Make sure 'QItemSelection' is registered using qRegisterMetaType().)
QWARN  : ModelListWidget_TEST::ModelProperties() QObject::connect: Cannot queue arguments of type 'QItemSelection'
(Make sure 'QItemSelection' is registered using qRegisterMetaType().)
SharePercentChange[0.457536] ShareMaxPercentChange[1]
ResPercentChange[1.10938]ResMaxPercentChange[3]
PASS   : ModelListWidget_TEST::cleanupTestCase()
Totals: 2 passed, 1 failed, 0 skipped
********* Finished testing of ModelListWidget_TEST *********
~~~

When the tests are all run in a row, the PhysicsProperties test fails. Perhaps there is a teardown problem between tests?

~~~
PASS   : ModelListWidget_TEST::LinkProperties()
QFATAL : ModelListWidget_TEST::PhysicsProperties() Received signal 11
FAIL!  : ModelListWidget_TEST::PhysicsProperties() Received a fatal error.
   Loc: [Unknown file(0)]
Totals: 4 passed, 2 failed, 0 skipped
********* Finished testing of ModelListWidget_TEST *********
Aborted (core dumped)
~~~

Perhaps @chapulina and @iche033 can advise how to fix this test.
values.title: Merge gazebo7 -> default

values.description: As discussed in [gazebo_design pull request 33](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/pull-requests/33/document-design-of-gazebo-event-callback/diff#Levent_callbacks/event_callbacks.mdT180), the `Event::Disconnect(ConnectionPtr)` functions are un-necessary, since the only requirement is to delete the `Connection` object, or more commonly, reset the `ConnectionPtr`. This PR deprecates all the Disconnect functions that take ConnectionPtr as an input and fixes the corresponding deprecation warnings, often by simply resetting `ConnectionPtr`s.
values.title: Deprecate Event::Disconnect(ConnectionPtr) in favor of reseting the ConnectionPtr

summary.raw: As discussed in [gazebo_design pull request 33](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/pull-requests/33/document-design-of-gazebo-event-callback/diff#Levent_callbacks/event_callbacks.mdT180), the `Event::Disconnect(ConnectionPtr)` functions are un-necessary, since the only requirement is to delete the `Connection` object, or more commonly, reset the `ConnectionPtr`. This PR deprecates all the Disconnect functions that take ConnectionPtr as an input and fixes the corresponding deprecation warnings, often by simply resetting `ConnectionPtr`s.
summary.html: As discussed in gazebo_design pull request 33, the Event::Disconnect(ConnectionPtr) functions are un-necessary, since the only requirement is to delete the Connection object, or more commonly, reset the ConnectionPtr. This PR deprecates all the Disconnect functions that take ConnectionPtr as an input and fixes the corresponding deprecation warnings, often by simply resetting ConnectionPtrs.

values.description:
The motivation behind this PR is to clean up the way we remove visuals and it's ogre data structures. It's also a step towards abstracting gazebo rendering away from ogre. 

The expected behavior now is that when a visual is removed, its child visuals will also be removed. *Visual classes should not need to worry about cleaning up ogre-specific objects now, `Visual::Fini` should be sufficient in most cases.

- replaced ogre scene nodes in *Visual classes with child visuals

- added more *Visual unit tests

- re-enabled checks in `ModelMaker_TEST.cc` to verify visuals are removed

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/458/testReport/) - ok
values.title: Refactor Visual classes

summary.html:
The motivation behind this PR is to clean up the way we remove visuals and it's ogre data structures. It's also a step towards abstracting gazebo rendering away from ogre.

The expected behavior now is that when a visual is removed, its child visuals will also be removed. *Visual classes should not need to worry about cleaning up ogre-specific objects now, Visual::Fini should be sufficient in most cases.

  • replaced ogre scene nodes in *Visual classes with child visuals

  • added more *Visual unit tests

  • re-enabled checks in ModelMaker_TEST.cc to verify visuals are removed

values.description:
There was noticeable rendering performance degradation when moving the mouse vigorously over the 3D scene in the main window. This is because  the mouse move events continuously trigger updates to the selection buffer used for mouse picking. 

This PR reduces the selection buffer's off-screen render texture size to 1x1 pixel (originally it was the size of viewport). Updates are now a lot faster. Code adapted from rviz.

Results from testing in `test/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world` on my machine:

- before: frame rate drops from ~50FPS to ~10FPS

- after: frame rate maintains at ~50FPS

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/465/) - ok
values.title: Use single pixel selection buffer for mouse picking

summary.html:
There was noticeable rendering performance degradation when moving the mouse vigorously over the 3D scene in the main window. This is because the mouse move events continuously trigger updates to the selection buffer used for mouse picking.

This PR reduces the selection buffer's off-screen render texture size to 1x1 pixel (originally it was the size of viewport). Updates are now a lot faster. Code adapted from rviz.

Results from testing in test/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world on my machine:

  • before: frame rate drops from ~50FPS to ~10FPS

  • after: frame rate maintains at ~50FPS

jenkins:

homebrew - ok

values.description:
Video:

https://youtu.be/dRQUDhhCZn0

* Make it possible to edit the default grid's:

    * Cell count
    * Cell length
    * Normal count (it's a bit counter-intuitive, 0 means one grid in the vertical, it can be changed)
    * Height offset
    * Line color

* Some other things which might be interesting to edit but which are not included here:

    * Grid plane (orientation)
    * Line width (see issue #1978)
    * Cell length and count separated by axis

* Currently there are 2 grids on the scene by default. I removed the second, lighter one. In case someone feels strongly about leaving it there, we can work it out, maybe add configurations for it as well.

* The grid's visibility can still be toggled from the `Edit` menu, maybe we can add an option the left panel, but we have to make sure the two options are in sync.

[trusty gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/460/testReport/) doesn't seem to have related failures
values.title: Edit grid from the GUI

summary.raw:
Video:

https://youtu.be/dRQUDhhCZn0

* Make it possible to edit the default grid's:

    * Cell count
    * Cell length
    * Normal count (it's a bit counter-intuitive, 0 means one grid in the vertical, it can be changed)
    * Height offset
    * Line color

* Some other things which might be interesting to edit but which are not included here:

    * Grid plane (orientation)
    * Line width (see issue #1978)
    * Cell length and count separated by axis

* Currently there are 2 grids on the scene by default. I removed the second, lighter one. In case someone feels strongly about leaving it there, we can work it out, maybe add configurations for it as well.

* The grid's visibility can still be toggled from the `Edit` menu, maybe we can add an option the left panel, but we have to make sure the two options are in sync.

[trusty gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/460/testReport/) doesn't seem to have related failures

Video:

https://youtu.be/dRQUDhhCZn0

  • Make it possible to edit the default grid's:

    • Cell count
    • Cell length
    • Normal count (it's a bit counter-intuitive, 0 means one grid in the vertical, it can be changed)
    • Height offset
    • Line color

  • Some other things which might be interesting to edit but which are not included here:

    • Grid plane (orientation)
    • Line width (see issue #1978)
    • Cell length and count separated by axis

  • Currently there are 2 grids on the scene by default. I removed the second, lighter one. In case someone feels strongly about leaving it there, we can work it out, maybe add configurations for it as well.

  • The grid's visibility can still be toggled from the Edit menu, maybe we can add an option the left panel, but we have to make sure the two options are in sync.

trusty gpu doesn't seem to have related failures

values.description:
* Surgery to config.bat for setting up cmake with Windows. Updated Cmakelist files to include ign-tranpsort and dependencies.

* Added missing zmq lib path input to cmake.

This pull request also includes changes minor changes in a previous pull request that allowed gazebo to build on Windows.
values.title: Config and cmake fixes for Windows build

summary.raw:
* Surgery to config.bat for setting up cmake with Windows. Updated Cmakelist files to include ign-tranpsort and dependencies.

* Added missing zmq lib path input to cmake.

This pull request also includes changes minor changes in a previous pull request that allowed gazebo to build on Windows.
summary.html:
• Surgery to config.bat for setting up cmake with Windows. Updated Cmakelist files to include ign-tranpsort and dependencies.

  • Added missing zmq lib path input to cmake.

This pull request also includes changes minor changes in a previous pull request that allowed gazebo to build on Windows.

values.description:
Without this patch, `sudo ninja install` fails if `ronn` is installed. 

Some additional checks are probably necessary to make it work with multiple config CMake generators, but this will fix the CMake for all single config generators such as make and ninja .
values.title: Fix install target when building with ninja

summary.raw:
Without this patch, `sudo ninja install` fails if `ronn` is installed. 

Some additional checks are probably necessary to make it work with multiple config CMake generators, but this will fix the CMake for all single config generators such as make and ninja .
summary.html:
Without this patch, sudo ninja install fails if ronn is installed.

Some additional checks are probably necessary to make it work with multiple config CMake generators, but this will fix the CMake for all single config generators such as make and ninja .

values.description: Some duplicate code was introduced in the cmake config file by a merge (5->6) in 114e3ce. It was later merged to gazebo7, which changes behavior, since the `GAZEBO_VERSION` references were changed to `GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION`. This removes the duplicate code.
values.title: Remove duplicate code from cmake config file caused by bad merge

values.description:
See  issue #1985.

To verify the fix:

* Insert a box, select it, right click, view, and then, enable some of the options.
* Remove it.
* Insert a box, select it, right click, view and all the options should be disabled.

[trusty nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/471/) :large_orange_diamond: (Two failures but seems unrelated).

values.description:
A camera sensor plugin that publishes the image coordinates of all fiducials detected in the image

a fiducial model is detected only when ~~~a) it's bounding box is within the camera frustum, and b)~~~ its center point is not occluded by other models in the camera view.

added an example `fiducial` world to demo the sensor plugin

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/490/) - ok
values.title: Add FiducialCameraPlugin for Camera Sensors

added an example `fiducial` world to demo the sensor plugin

summary.html:
A camera sensor plugin that publishes the image coordinates of all fiducials detected in the image

a fiducial model is detected only when ~a) it's bounding box is within the camera frustum, and b)~ its center point is not occluded by other models in the camera view.

added an example fiducial world to demo the sensor plugin

jenkins:

homebrew - ok

values.description:
This pull request has a few small fixes to actors. There will be more pull requests coming as we keep working on branch [`generalize_actor`](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/generalize_actor). I'm writing [this](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=actor&branch=actor) tutorial as I work on that branch, stay tuned!

* Fix `walk.dae` so it can be used for both skin and animation on `actor.world`

* Fixed the units on several meshes to make them load properly. You can try any of the following meshes in the simple world below:

    * moonwalk.dae
    * run.dae
    * sit_down.dae
    * sitting.dae
    * stand_up.dae
    * stand.dae
    * talk_a.dae
    * talk_b.dae
    * walk.dae

~~~ 
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.6">
   <world name="default">
      <include>
         <uri>model://sun</uri>
      </include>
      <actor name="actor">
         <skin>
            <filename>walk.dae</filename>
         </skin>
      </actor>
   </world>
</sdf>
~~~ 

* Added a few checks where Gazebo was crashing when trying to load different mesh files.

* Started adding documentation to `physics::Actor` as I start making sense of the code.

* Suppressed the errors `Error [Element.hh:336] Unable to find value for key[enable_wind]` which currently show up if you load `actor.world`.
values.title: Fix some actor animations

I'm writing [this](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=actor&branch=actor) tutorial as I work on that branch, stay tuned!

* Fix `walk.dae` so it can be used for both skin and animation on `actor.world`

* Fixed the units on several meshes to make them load properly. You can try any of the following meshes in the simple world below:

    * moonwalk.dae
    * run.dae
    * sit_down.dae
    * sitting.dae
    * stand_up.dae
    * stand.dae
    * talk_a.dae
    * talk_b.dae
    * walk.dae

~~~ 
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.6">
   <world name="default">
      <include>
         <uri>model://sun</uri>
      </include>
      <actor name="actor">
         <skin>
            <filename>walk.dae</filename>
         </skin>
      </actor>

</sdf>
~~~ 

* Added a few checks where Gazebo was crashing when trying to load different mesh files.

* Started adding documentation to `physics::Actor` as I start making sense of the code.

* Suppressed the errors `Error [Element.hh:336] Unable to find value for key[enable_wind]` which currently show up if you load `actor.world`.
summary.html:
This pull request has a few small fixes to actors. There will be more pull requests coming as we keep working on branch generalize_actor. I'm writing this tutorial as I work on that branch, stay tuned!

  • Fix walk.dae so it can be used for both skin and animation on actor.world

  • Fixed the units on several meshes to make them load properly. You can try any of the following meshes in the simple world below:

    • moonwalk.dae
    • run.dae
    • sit_down.dae
    • sitting.dae
    • stand_up.dae
    • stand.dae
    • talk_a.dae
    • talk_b.dae
    • walk.dae
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.6">
   <world name="default">
      <include>
         <uri>model://sun</uri>
      </include>
      <actor name="actor">
         <skin>
            <filename>walk.dae</filename>
         </skin>
      </actor>
   </world>
</sdf>

  • Added a few checks where Gazebo was crashing when trying to load different mesh files.

  • Started adding documentation to physics::Actor as I start making sense of the code.

  • Suppressed the errors Error [Element.hh:336] Unable to find value for key[enable_wind] which currently show up if you load actor.world.
